topic: Vision-Language Model Bias and Fairness Research

  entities:

    VHELM|Method

  proposition: Meiqi Chen and colleagues quantify and mitigate unimodal biases in multimodal large language models from a causal perspective.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Meiqi Chen|RESEARCHES|unimodal biases
    Meiqi Chen|STUDIES|multimodal large language models
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Meiqi Chen|COLLABORATES_WITH|colleagues

  proposition: Moreno D'Incà and researchers propose improving fairness using vision-language driven image augmentation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Moreno D'Incà|RESEARCHES|fairness
    Moreno D'Incà|PROPOSES|vision-language driven image augmentation
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Moreno D'Incà|COLLABORATES_WITH|researchers

  proposition: Ashish Seth and coauthors introduce DeAR, a method for debiasing vision-language models with additive residuals.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Ashish Seth|INTRODUCES|DeAR
    DeAR|TYPE|method for debiasing vision-language models
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Ashish Seth|COLLABORATES_WITH|coauthors
    DeAR|ADDRESSES|vision-language models

  proposition: Yi Zhang and team develop a method for counterfactually measuring and eliminating social bias in vision-language pre-training models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yi Zhang|DEVELOPS|method for counterfactual bias measurement
    Yi Zhang|FOCUSES_ON|social bias elimination
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yi Zhang|COLLABORATES_WITH|team

  proposition: Laura Gustafson and colleagues create FACET, a fairness evaluation benchmark for computer vision.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Laura Gustafson|CREATES|FACET
    FACET|TYPE|fairness evaluation benchmark
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Laura Gustafson|COLLABORATES_WITH|colleagues

  proposition: Gabriele Ruggeri and Debora Nozza conduct a multi-dimensional study on bias in vision-language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Gabriele Ruggeri|CONDUCTS|multi-dimensional bias study
    Debora Nozza|CONDUCTS|multi-dimensional bias study
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Gabriele Ruggeri|COLLABORATES_WITH|Debora Nozza

  proposition: Eric Slyman and team develop FairDeDup to detect and mitigate fairness disparities in semantic dataset deduplication.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Eric Slyman|DEVELOPS|FairDeDup
    FairDeDup|PURPOSE|detect fairness disparities
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Eric Slyman|COLLABORATES_WITH|team
    FairDeDup|ADDRESSES|semantic dataset deduplication

  proposition: Ashutosh Sathe and coauthors create a unified framework and dataset for assessing gender bias in vision-language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Ashutosh Sathe|CREATES|unified framework
    Ashutosh Sathe|CREATES|dataset for gender bias assessment
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Ashutosh Sathe|COLLABORATES_WITH|coauthors

  proposition: Sepehr Janghorbani and Gerard De Melo introduce a framework for assessing stereotypical bias beyond gender and race in vision-language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Sepehr Janghorbani|INTRODUCES|bias assessment framework
    Gerard De Melo|INTRODUCES|bias assessment framework
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Sepehr Janghorbani|COLLABORATES_WITH|Gerard De Melo

  proposition: Zecheng Wang and colleagues investigate debiasing multimodal large language models through model editing.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zecheng Wang|INVESTIGATES|debiasing multimodal large language models
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Zecheng Wang|COLLABORATES_WITH|colleagues
